description: Standalone mock server separation from frontend
gap_description: Mock server is a separate Next.js project at /h2-tank-mock-server with its own package.json and independent build. Can be run standalone on port 3001.
notes: Fully implemented. Separate project structure with independent dependencies.

description: OpenAPI 3.0 specification as source of truth
gap_description: No openapi-h2-tank-api.yaml file exists. API contract is only defined in TypeScript route implementations. Missing central schema definition.
notes: CRITICAL: Need to create OpenAPI spec from existing implementations. All endpoints are working but undocumented.

gap_description: Frontend has environment configuration capability but no documentation of how to switch backends. Need .env.example file.
notes: Infrastructure exists but needs documentation and .env.example template.

gap_description: Static data mode is implemented with JSON files in /data/static/* for designs, materials, standards, and pareto sets.
notes: Working. 5 design files (A-E), comprehensive material database, standards, and 50-design Pareto set.

description: Simulated data mode for testing with simulation engines
gap_description: Simulation engines exist for optimization, stress, thermal analysis. Uses physics-based calculations with controlled randomness.
notes: Excellent physics implementation with real equations. Includes SCF calculations, Tsai-Wu, Hashin criteria.

gap_description: SSE endpoint implemented with proper content-type headers and async generator pattern.
notes: Fully working SSE stream using ReadableStream and QuickOptimizationSimulator.

description: Real-time progress events, best design updates, completion events
gap_description: All event types (progress, best_update, complete) are emitted by OptimizationSimulator.
notes: Event streaming works with realistic timing and data progression.

description: GET /api/materials - Material database with type filtering
gap_description: Comprehensive material endpoint with filtering by type (carbon_fiber, glass_fiber, matrix, liner, boss). Returns structured material data with all CLT properties.
notes: Excellent implementation. 5 separate JSON files for material categories. Proper error handling and CORS.

gap_description: Returns design summary for designs A-E. Includes weight, burst pressure, cost, reliability metrics. Proper 404 handling.
notes: Working. Validates design ID, reads from static JSON, returns flattened + nested structure for compatibility.

description: GET /api/designs/[id]/stress - Stress analysis with SCF calculations
gap_description: Physics-based stress calculation using real pressure vessel equations. Includes SCF at dome-cylinder transition, boss interface, ply drops. Through-thickness gradient. Contour data generation.
notes: EXCELLENT: Implements REQ-203 to REQ-210 SCF requirements. Real physics with hoop/axial stress from first principles.

description: GET /api/designs/[id]/failure - Failure analysis with Tsai-Wu and Hashin
gap_description: Complete failure analysis implementation. Tsai-Wu index per layer, Hashin criteria (4 modes), progressive failure sequence, first ply failure prediction.
notes: EXCELLENT: Uses real composite failure theories with proper coordinate transforms. Stress transformation for fiber angles.

gap_description: Fast-fill thermal simulation with time-series temperature profiles (gas, wall, liner). CTE mismatch data, extreme temperature performance.
notes: Working thermal model with realistic lag between gas/wall/liner temperatures. Includes material property effects.

description: GET /api/designs/[id]/sentry - Sensor placement and inspection schedule
gap_description: Comprehensive sensor specification with 6 sensor locations (strain, acoustic, temperature). Inspection schedule from daily to 5-year recertification.
notes: Excellent detail: 3D coordinates, sensor types, critical flags, inspection intervals with rationale.

gap_description: Compliance checking against ISO 11119-3, UN R134, EC 79/2009. Clause-by-clause breakdown with actual vs required values.
notes: Working. Pass/fail per standard, detailed clause comparison with evidence.

description: POST /api/requirements/parse - NL parsing with structured extraction
gap_description: Natural language parser with regex extraction for pressure, volume, weight, cost, temperature, burst ratio, permeation, fatigue. Confidence scoring. Supports both NL and structured input.
notes: Smart parser with confidence calculation based on extracted fields. Derives test/burst pressure from working pressure.

gap_description: Tank type selection logic based on weight/volume ratio. Recommends Type I-V with confidence, reasoning, alternatives with pros/cons.
notes: Sophisticated recommendation engine with feasibility checking, environment considerations (e.g., marine).

gap_description: Returns comprehensive standards database from static JSON.
notes: Simple endpoint returning standards data. Works as expected.

gap_description: Creates optimization job with unique ID, returns stream URL. In-memory job store.
notes: Simple job creation. Actual optimization happens via SSE stream endpoint.

gap_description: Compares multiple designs side-by-side. Returns comparison table, radar chart data, metrics with 'better' indicators.
notes: Good implementation with normalized radar metrics, 'better' design identification per metric.

gap_description: Endpoint exists and returns export job ID. However, actual export generation is stubbed - no real ZIP or STEP file generation.
notes: Placeholder implementation. Need to add actual file generation for ZIP packages, STEP export requires CAD kernel.

gap_description: Extremely comprehensive laboratory database with 7 global testing facilities (TÜV SÜD, DNV, BAM, CSA, Intertek, SwRI, JRC). Includes capabilities, costs, lead times, contact info, certification pathways.
notes: OVER_SCOPE: This endpoint was not in requirements but is excellent value-add. 434 lines of detailed lab data.

gap_description: Endpoint exists for providing example requirements to users. Not in original spec but useful feature.
notes: OVER_SCOPE: Nice-to-have feature for user onboarding.

gap_description: Endpoint for export configuration categories. Not required but improves UX.
notes: OVER_SCOPE: Supports dynamic export UI configuration.

gap_description: Manufacturing endpoints for cure cycles and winding programs. Not in v1.0 spec.
notes: OVER_SCOPE: Future enhancement for manufacturing support.

gap_description: Validation and verification endpoints for V&V workflow. Beyond v1.0 scope.
notes: OVER_SCOPE: Enterprise feature for formal V&V processes.

gap_description: Returns geometry data from design JSON files including dimensions, dome profile, layup.
notes: Working. Note: Design JSON files use spherical approximation, not true isotensoid (see REQ-197 gap).

gap_description: Returns cost breakdown from design data.
notes: Working endpoint returning material, labor, tooling costs.

gap_description: Monte Carlo simulation with probability of failure, confidence intervals, histogram data.
notes: Physics-based MC simulation using normal distribution for burst pressure with material variance.

gap_description: Returns surrogate model confidence metrics and accuracy indicators.
notes: Working endpoint for model validation UI.

gap_description: Generates test plan with hydraulic burst, pressure cycling, permeation, bonfire tests per standards.
notes: Working. Test plan linked to compliance requirements.

gap_description: Detailed view of individual standards. Not required but improves UX.
notes: OVER_SCOPE: Nice enhancement for standards explorer.

description: Physics calculation library with verified equations
gap_description: Comprehensive physics library with pressure vessel equations, composite analysis (Tsai-Wu, Hashin), fatigue, permeation, reliability. Includes unit tests.
notes: EXCELLENT: Real engineering physics with proper equations. Test file validates hoop/axial stress ratio = 2.0.

gap_description: No /api/health endpoint exists. Need for load balancer health checks and monitoring.
notes: Standard practice for production services. Should return 200 OK with server status.

gap_description: All endpoints include proper CORS headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *) and OPTIONS handlers.
code_locations: All route.ts files include OPTIONS handler and CORS headers
notes: Consistently implemented across all endpoints.

gap_description: All endpoints use try-catch with consistent error response: {error: string, message?: string}. Proper HTTP status codes (400, 404, 500).
code_locations: All route.ts files include error handling
notes: Good error handling pattern throughout.

description: Unit tests for endpoints and physics
gap_description: Only one test file found: physics-verification.test.ts. No endpoint tests, no simulator tests, no integration tests.
notes: GAP: Need endpoint tests, simulator tests. Existing physics test is good quality.

gap_description: Mock server has a status page at root URL showing available endpoints and visualizations. Uses Recharts for data display.
notes: OVER_SCOPE: Nice status UI with tank visualization and stress charts. 442 lines of UI code.

description: No persistent storage required for v1.0
gap_description: Mock server uses in-memory storage for optimization jobs and static JSON files. No database needed.
notes: Correct approach for mock server. Map-based job storage, JSON file-based data.

gap_description: No /api/requirements/chat endpoint exists. Requirements parsing exists but not conversational chat.
notes: REQ-190-196 require multi-turn LLM dialogue. Only parse endpoint exists, not chat.

gap_description: No schema validation middleware. TypeScript provides compile-time type safety but no runtime validation.
notes: Could use Zod or similar for runtime validation once OpenAPI spec exists.

gap_description: Not applicable for v1.0 mock server. Production backend should implement.
notes: NA for mock server, required for production.

gap_description: Only console.error logging in catch blocks. No structured logging, no log levels, no request logging.
notes: Need structured logging (Winston/Pino) for production readiness.
